sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令（あすかきよみはらりょう）は、日本の飛鳥時代後期に制定された体系的な法典。
sen.e: Asukakyomihara-ryo Code is a systematic legal code that was enacted in the second half of the Asuka period in Japan.
Asukakyomihara-ryo Code is a systematic legal code that was enacted in the second half of the Asuka period in Japan.
Asukakyomihara-ryo Code is a systematic legal code that was enacted in the second half of the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 令22巻。
sen.e: It consists of 22 volumes of ryo codes.
It consisted of 22 volumes of the ryo code (the administrative and civil code).
sen.cmt: 令の意味を補足しました。
sen.e: It consisted of 22 volumes of the ryo code (the administrative and civil code).

sen.j: 律令のうち令のみが制定・施行されたものである。
sen.e: Of the ritsuryo codes, only the ryo codes were established and enforced.
Of the ritsu (the penal code) and ryo codes, only the ryo code was established and put in force.
sen.cmt: 律と令を分けて表現しました。
sen.e: Of the ritsu (the penal code) and ryo codes, only the ryo code was established and put in force.

sen.j: 日本史上、最初の体系的な律令法と考えられているが、現存しておらず、詳細は不明な部分が多い。
sen.e: Although it is thought to be the first systematic ritsuryo code in Japanese history, the volumes do not exist and many of the details are not known.
Although it is thought to be the first systematic ritsuryo code in Japanese history, the volumes do not exist and many of the details are unknown.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令に先行する律令法には、天智天皇が668年に制定したとされる近江令がある。
sen.e: As a ritsuryo code that preceded Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code, there is Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), which is said to have been enacted by Emperor Tenchi in 668.
As a ritsuryo code that preceded Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code, there is Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), which is said to have been enacted by Emperor Tenchi in 668.
As a ritsuryo code that preceded Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code, there is Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), which is said to have been enacted by Emperor Tenchi in 668.

sen.j: 近江令の存在については、非存在説も含めて見解が分かれているが、近江令とは、律令制を指向する単行法令を総称したものであり、体系的な法典ではなかったとする見方が広く支持されている。
sen.e: Although there are various views on Omi-Ryo, including non-existence, the most popular view is that it was a generic name for various individual laws and ordinances that were written with the aim of being part of the ritsuryo system and that it was not a systematic code.

Among various views on Omi-Ryo including the one which insists on its nonexistence, the most popular one is that it was a generic name for various individual laws and ordinances made with the aim of establishment of the system ruled by the ritsuryo codes and was not a systematic code.
sen.cmt: 分かりづらい表現があったので、意味をなるべくはっきりさせるよう修正を加えました。
sen.e: Among various views on Omi-Ryo including the one which insists on its nonexistence, the most popular one is that it was a generic name for various individual laws and ordinances made with the aim of establishment of the system ruled by the ritsuryo codes and was not a systematic code.

sen.j: 天智天皇を後継した弘文天皇から、軍事力によって政権を奪取した天武天皇は、政権中枢を皇子らで占める皇親政治を開始し、専制的な政治を行っていった。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu, who used military force to seize power from Emperor Kobun, the successor of Emperor Tenchi, began conducting Koshin politics under which princes and other members of the Imperial family were given key posts of government, and was very autocratic.

Emperor Tenmu, who had seized political power by force of arms from Emperor Kobun, the successor of Emperor Tenchi, began conducting Koshin politics, under which Imperial princes and other Imperial family members assumed key posts in the government, and thus strengthened the autocracy.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするため表現を変えました。
sen.e: Emperor Tenmu, who had seized political power by force of arms from Emperor Kobun, the successor of Emperor Tenchi, began conducting Koshin politics, under which Imperial princes and other Imperial family members assumed key posts in the government, and thus strengthened the autocracy.

sen.j: 天武は、その強力な政治意思を執行していくために、官僚制度とそれを規定する諸法令を整備していった。
sen.e: In order to enforce his powerful political views, he established a bureaucratic system and various laws to regulate the system.
In order to enforce his powerful political views, he established a bureaucratic system and various laws to regulate the system.
In order to enforce his powerful political views, he established a bureaucratic system and various laws to regulate the system.

sen.j: このような官僚（官人）と法律を重視する支配方針は、支配原則が共通する律令制の導入へと帰着した。
sen.e: This governing philosophy, which values bureaucrats and law culminated in the ritsuryo system, which shares the same principle.

Such governance philosophy that highly valued bureaucrats (or government officials) and laws culminated in the introduction of the ritsuryo system (the system of centralized administration established under the ritsuryo legal codes), since it shared the same governance principle.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、分かりやすいよう説明を（若干の訳漏れも含め）補足しました。
sen.e: Such governance philosophy that highly valued bureaucrats (or government officials) and laws culminated in the introduction of the ritsuryo system (the system of centralized administration established under the ritsuryo legal codes), since it shared the same governance principle.

sen.j: 天武10年2月25日（681年）、天武は皇子・諸臣に対して、律令制定を命ずる詔を発令した。
sen.e: On February 25, 681, Emperor Tenmu issued an imperial decree ordering princes and retainers to establish a ritsuryo system.
On February 25, 681, Emperor Tenmu issued an imperial decree ordering princes and retainers to establish a ritsuryo system.

sen.j: しかし、律令が完成する前の686年に天武が没したため、その皇后の持統天皇と皇太子の草壁皇子が律令事業を継承した。
sen.e: But since Emperor Tenmu died in 686 before the ritsuyo system was established, Empress Jito and Crown Prince Kusakabe inherited the ritsuryo enterprise.
But since Emperor Tenmu died in 686 before the ritsuyo code was completed, Empress Jito and Crown Prince Kusakabe inherited the enterprise to conclude it.
sen.cmt: Systemをcodeに直しました。単語の重複を避けました。
sen.e: But since Emperor Tenmu died in 686 before the ritsuyo code was completed, Empress Jito and Crown Prince Kusakabe inherited the enterprise to conclude it.

sen.j: 服喪があけた後に、草壁が次期天皇に即位する予定だった。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe was supposed to be coroneted as the next emperor after the period of mourning was over.
Prince Kusakabe was supposed to ascend the throne after the period of mourning was over.
sen.cmt: Coronetの用法が確認できなかったので表現を変えました。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe was supposed to ascend the throne after the period of mourning was over.

sen.j: しかし、草壁は持統3年4月（689年）に急死した。
sen.e: But Prince Kusakabe died suddenly in April 689.
But, he died suddenly in April 689.
sen.cmt: 重複を避けheで置き換えました。
sen.e: But, he died suddenly in April 689.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令が諸官司に頒布されたのは、その直後の同年6月である。
sen.e: It was soon afterwards in June of that year that Asukakiyomihararyo Code was distributed to government officials.
It was right after that, in June of that year, that Asukakiyomihararyo Code was distributed to government officials.
It was right after that, in June of that year, that Asukakiyomihararyo Code was distributed to government officials.

sen.j: 律は制定されず、令のみが唐突に頒布されていることから、草壁の死による政府内の動揺を抑え、天武の（律令制定という）遺志の継承を明示するため、予定を前倒しして、令のみが急遽公布されたのだと考えられている。
sen.e: Since ryo was distributed suddenly without ritsu, it is believed that ryo was issued suddenly ahead of schedule in order to calm the unrest within the government caused by the sudden death of Prince Kusakabe and to clearly signal that the will of Emperor Tenmu to enact ritsuryo was being followed.

Since all of a sudden only ryo was distributed without ritsu, it is believed that ryo was issued ahead of schedule in haste in order to quell the unrest within the government caused by the sudden death of Prince Kusakabe and to clearly express that the will of Emperor Tenmu to enact ritsuryo would be followed.
sen.cmt: 単語の重複を避けるため、多少言葉を変えました。
sen.e: Since all of a sudden only ryo was distributed without ritsu, it is believed that ryo was issued ahead of schedule in haste in order to quell the unrest within the government caused by the sudden death of Prince Kusakabe and to clearly express that the will of Emperor Tenmu to enact ritsuryo would be followed.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令により、いくつかの重要な事項が本令により定められたとされている。
sen.e: It is said that Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code determined some important issues.
It is said that Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code determined some important issues.

sen.j: 天皇号は本令により規定されたとする説があるが、むしろ、天武期において天皇号が制定され、本令により法典に明記されたのだとする説が有力である。
sen.e: There is a view that the title of Tenno was regulated by this ryo, but the alternative view that it was established during the Tenmu period and was written into law by this ryo seems to be accepted more widely.

There is a view that the title of Tenno was regulated by this ryo, but another view that it was established during the reign of Emperor Tenmu and was written into law by this ryo is accepted more widely.

sen.e: There is a view that the title of Tenno was regulated by this ryo, but another view that it was established during the reign of Emperor Tenmu and was written into law by this ryo is accepted more widely.

sen.j: その他、古代の戸籍制度を6年に1回作成すること（六年一造）、50戸を1里とする地方制度、班田収授法に関する規定など、律令制の骨格が本令により制度化されたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that the structural framework of the Ritsuryo system, such as establishing that the ancient family registration survey must be conducted every six years, determining a regional system founded on 50 houses as one village, and the rules regarding the law of rice field allotment system, was organized by this ryo.

It is believed that the structural framework of the ritsuryo system was systematized by this code, which included the stipulation that the ancient family register had to be revised every six years, definition of the smallest administrative division consisting of 50 families in the regional system, and the enactment of the law of the rice field allotment system.
sen.cmt: なるべく分かりやすい表現となるよう全体的に修正しました。
sen.e: It is believed that the structural framework of the ritsuryo system was systematized by this code, which included the stipulation that the ancient family register had to be revised every six years, definition of the smallest administrative division consisting of 50 families in the regional system, and the enactment of the law of the rice field allotment system.

sen.j: なお、律も併せて制定されたとする説（飛鳥浄御原律令説）もあるが、律は制定されず、唐律が適用されたとするのが通説である。
sen.e: There is a view that ritsu was enacted at the same time (Asukakiyomihara Ritsurei theory), but it is more common to accept the view that ritsu was not enacted and Tang Code was applied.

There is a theory which says that ritsu was enacted at the same time (the Asukakiyomihara Ritsuryo theory), but a commonly accepted view is that at the time the ritsu part was adopted from Tang Code but not established in its own terms.
sen.cmt: 感じの読み違いあり、また唐律という言葉が正確に訳されていない感じがありましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: There is a theory which says that ritsu was enacted at the same time (the Asukakiyomihara Ritsuryo theory), but a commonly accepted view is that at the time the ritsu part was adopted from Tang Code but not established in its own terms.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令は、急遽施行されたという事情もあり、必ずしも完成された内容ではなかった。
sen.e: Partly because it was enacted in a rush, Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code was not necessarily a completed product.
Partly because it was enacted in such a rush, Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code was not really a completed product.
sen.cmt: 一部単語を変えました。
sen.e: Partly because it was enacted in such a rush, Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code was not really a completed product.

sen.j: そのため、律令の編纂作業はその後も継続していき、最終的に701年の大宝律令によって、天武が企図した律令編纂事業が完成することとなった。
sen.e: Hence, the compilation of the ritsuryo codes continued even after the issuance of Asukakiyomihara-ryo Code and the enterprise of compiling the ritsuryo codes that Emperor Tenmu had undertaken was finalized as Taiho Ritsuryo Code in 701.
Hence, the compilation of the code continued after its issuance, and the enterprise which had been undertaken by Emperor Tenmu was finalized with Taiho Ritsuryo Code in 701 at last.
sen.cmt: ここで言う「律令」は文脈より飛鳥浄御原令のことと思うので、codeは単数形とし、語の重複は避けました。
sen.e: Hence, the compilation of the code continued after its issuance, and the enterprise which had been undertaken by Emperor Tenmu was finalized with Taiho Ritsuryo Code in 701 at last.
